A very solid port of the board game; I wish I could give it 5 stars, but many minor issues all add up to a diminished experience.  First, the "best" AI is weak... REALLY weak. They prioritize 25- and 40-point quests without the time or means to get the resources. They don't prioritize strong Plot Quests at any stage of the game, ignoring or abandoning them for minor gains. They mostly hit each other with Intrigue Cards (especially Mandatory Quests) instead of the player, and over-prioritize playing them. And the biggest flaw: they don't prioritize their hidden Lord bonus AT ALL.  There are a few graphic bugs, but the biggest is that the wrong Lord shows in the post-game for Undermountain lords. The right lord shows during final scoring, but it is then wrong in the last screen.  Finally, some rules errors are present. An example: putting a building into play with Lure Artisans of Mirabar should not reward bonus VPs from Infiltrate Builder's Hall (it's not buying a building).  All in all, it's very solid, but far from perfect. I love the game, however, and it's nice and convenient, so it gets 4 stars.
